question: The college admission  process?
answer: Admission Process:- Allotment on the basis of JEE mains/UPCET Counselling conductted by AKTU, Lucknow (85% of total seat) and Direct Admission (15 % of Total Seat). For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: How does the college direct admission  process?
answer: Register yourself and fill the form on following link:- https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: How does the college admission process work?
answer: • UPCET Counselling - The candidate needs to appear for the JEE Exam and appear in online counselling of UPCET. Candidate needs to opt NIET as the preferred choice in any of the branches we offer. Direct Admission - The college may conduct admission tests / on a merit basis / other criteria defined by the college admission policy. In case you meet the eligibility criteria as per AKTU norms, then the application is further processed for document verification. Upon successful verification, you will be offered provisional admission.

question: What is the admission process for First Year  Btech?
answer: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination of U.P. Board 10+2 level examination from any recognized board/university Securing minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in total of required subject combination. For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the admission process for First Year  B.Pharm?
answer: Candidate must have passed (with/without grace) intermediate examination of U.P. Board 10+2 level examination or its equivalent with Physics and Chemistry compulsory subjects along with Mathematics/ Biology subjects.

question: What is the admission process for First Year  MCA?
answer: The candidate must have passed three years degree course from any recognized University; securing a minimum 50% (45% for SC/ST) marks in aggregate. The candidate must have a minimum 50% (45% for SC/ST) marks in mathematics at 10 + 2 level or bachelor’s degree level.

question: What is the admission process for First Year  MBA?
answer: The candidate must have passed three years of degree course from any recognized University; securing a minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in aggregate. For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the admission process for Lateral Entry Btech?
answer: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Engineering securing a minimum 45% (40% for SC/ST) marks in mathematics. For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the admission process for Lateral Entry B.Pharam?
answer: The candidate must have passed three years of Diploma in Pharmacy

question: What is the admission process for Other Process?
answer: The admission of NRI and Kashmiri migrants will be according to the norms laid down by the Govt of UP/AICTE This admission test is open only for candidates who have passed the qualifying examination from any institution located in U.P and the parents, father/mother of the students must be domiciles of U.P

question: What is the admission process for Fifteen percent (15%) of the approved?
answer: Intake of a course is filled under this category as per the Govt. of U.P. and AKTU guidelines There is usually a great rush for management quota seats. The students need to register themselves early to establish priority.For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the admission process for For admission to B.Tech courses?
answer: The candidate must have passed the intermediate examination or equivalent (10+2) with required subject combination The admission criteria is defined by the college admission policy.For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

course: For admission to the first year of MCA (2 years)
question: What is the admission process for For admission to the first year of MCA (2 years)?
answer: A candidate must have passed a bachelor’s degree course of three years minimum duration from any recognized Indian university or its equivalent.  Candidate must have passed Mathematics at 10+2 level graduation level and the admission criteria are defined by the college admission policy.For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

answer: The minimum qualification required is three years of bachelor’s degree in any discipline the admission criteria are defined by college admission policy.For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the admission process for For admission to M.Tech course?
answer: The minimum qualification required is a bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline. MCA is also eligible for the admission to M. Tech (Computer Science & Engineering) The admission criteria are defined by the college admission policy. For Registration:-  https://applynow.niet.co.in/

question: What is the Twinning admission process?
answer: A valid Passport with more than 4 years of expiry English proficiency preferably IELTS level 6 Sufficient funds to manage visa, airfare and living expenses No immigration check required Minimun 75% marks for Undergraduate Programs Minimun 60% marks for Post Graduate Programs with minimum attendance criteria and no backlogs
